etymologies: Middle English (in an earlier sense). From side + -ling

definitions: A slope or declivity, especially one with a track or road running transversely along its face.

notes.text: In early use also in plural in same sense.

definitions: Directed or moving sideways; sidelong, oblique. Of a look, glance, etc.: directed to the side or from the corner of the eye, especially furtively, or with suspicion or disapproval.

notes.text: Recorded earliest in the compound sidelingway: see discussion in etymology.

definitions: Of the ground: inclining, sloping, steep; specifically (of a track or trail) sloping transversely, so that one side is higher than the other.
